newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil soybean plantings two pct to Oct 24 - Safras.
newsitem.headline: Brazil soybean plantings two pct to Oct 24 - Safras.

text.p: Brazilian soybean plantings were two percent completed by October 24 against six percent by October 26, 1995 and an average of the past five years also of six percent, consultants Safras e Mercado said.
The slower rate Safras attributed to difficulties being experienced by farmers in attaining credit as well as adverse weather conditions in some areas.
In the southern states of Parana and Rio Grande do Sul, excess rain was preventing the wheat harvest from being completed.
But in the southeast (Sao Paulo state) and center-west (Mato Grosso, Mato Grosso do Sul and Goias), farmers in some regions were waiting for more uniform rain to prepare the soil.
"This delay is still small and does not present a problem for the next harvest," Safras said.
Plantings of the 1996/97 crop by October 24 per state as estimated by Safras are as follows in percentage terms.
-- Caroline Bulloch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 5074151
